title: What are the limitations of ReactJS?
answer1: React is only for view layer of the app so we still need the help of other technologies to get a complete tooling set for development
answer2: React is using inline templating and JSX. This can seem awkward to some developers
answer3: The library of react is too large

What are the advantages of React JS?
answer1: React can be used on client and as well as server side too
answer2: Using React increases readability and makes maintainability easier. Component, Data patterns improves readability and thus makes it easier for manitaining larger apps
answer3: React can be used with any other framework (Backbone.js, Angular.js) as it is only a view layer

answer2: When the new state depends on the old state

title: What will happen if you render an input element with disabled = {false}
answer1: It will be rendered as enabled
answer2: It will be rendered as disabled
answer3: It will not be rendered at all
